intro: Lappula semiglabra, commonly known as the smooth lappula, is an annual herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It typically grows in disturbed soils and along roadsides, preferring sunny to partially shaded environments. The plant has smooth, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. Its seeds are enclosed in a distinctive, bladder-like structure called a silique, which aids in seed dispersal. Lappula semiglabra is often found in moist habitats and is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations.
